00063 typedef struct
00064 {
00065   u8 ID;
00066   u16 Pin;
00067   AFIO_MODE_Enum Mode;
00068 } HT32_Board_GPIO_TypeDef;
00069 
00070 typedef struct
00071 {
00072   HT_USART_TypeDef* USARTx;
00073   HT32_Board_GPIO_TypeDef Tx_IO;
00074   HT32_Board_GPIO_TypeDef Rx_IO;
00075 } HT32_Board_COM_TypeDef;

00081 /* Private function prototypes -----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00082 static void _HT32F_DVB_ClockConfig(u32 GpioId);

00084 /* Global variables ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00085 /** @defgroup HT32F5xxxx_BOARD_Global_Variable HT32F5xxxx Board global variables
00086   * @{
00087   */
00088 
00089   HT_GPIO_TypeDef* const GPIO_PORT[GPIO_PORT_NUM] = {
00090     HT_GPIOA,
00091     HT_GPIOB,
00092     #if (LIBCFG_GPIOC)
00093     HT_GPIOC,
00094     #else
00095     0,
00096     #endif
00097     #if (LIBCFG_GPIOD)
00098     HT_GPIOD,
00099     #else
00100     0,
00101     #endif
00102     #if (LIBCFG_GPIOE)
00103     HT_GPIOE,
00104     #else
00105     0,
00106     #endif
00107     #if (LIBCFG_GPIOF)
00108     HT_GPIOF,
00109     #else
00110     0,
00111     #endif
00112   };
00113 
00114   const u8 LED_GPIO_ID[LEDn] = {LED1_GPIO_ID, LED2_GPIO_ID, LED3_GPIO_ID};
00115   const u16 LED_GPIO_PIN[LEDn] = {LED1_GPIO_PIN, LED2_GPIO_PIN, LED3_GPIO_PIN};
00116   const AFIO_MODE_Enum LED_AFIO_MODE[LEDn] = {LED1_AFIO_MODE, LED2_AFIO_MODE, LED3_AFIO_MODE};
00117 
00118   const u8 BUTTON_GPIO_ID[BUTTONn] = {WAKEUP_BUTTON_GPIO_ID, KEY1_BUTTON_GPIO_ID, KEY2_BUTTON_GPIO_ID};
00119   const u16 BUTTON_GPIO_PIN[BUTTONn] = {WAKEUP_BUTTON_GPIO_PIN, KEY1_BUTTON_GPIO_PIN, KEY2_BUTTON_GPIO_PIN};
00120   const AFIO_MODE_Enum BUTTON_AFIO_MODE[BUTTONn] = {
00121     WAKEUP_BUTTON_AFIO_MODE, KEY1_BUTTON_AFIO_MODE, KEY2_BUTTON_AFIO_MODE
00122   };
00123 
00124   const u8 BUTTON_GPIO_PINNum[BUTTONn] = {
00125     WAKEUP_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, KEY2_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL
00126   };
00127 
00128   const HT32_Board_COM_TypeDef gCOMInfo[COM_NUM] =
00129   {
00130     {
00131       COM1_PORT,
00132       { COM1_TX_GPIO_ID, COM1_TX_AFIO_PIN, COM1_TX_AFIO_MODE },
00133       { COM1_RX_GPIO_ID, COM1_RX_AFIO_PIN, COM1_RX_AFIO_MODE },
00134     },
00135   };

00141 /* Global functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00142 /** @defgroup HT32F5xxxx_BOARD_Global_Functions HT32F5xxxx Board global functions
00143   * @{
00144   */
00145 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00146  * @brief Configures LED GPIO.
00147  * @param HT_LEDn: Specifies the LED to be configured. This parameter can be one of the following values:
00148  *    @arg HT_LED1
00149  *    @arg HT_LED2
00150  *    @arg HT_LED3
00151  * @retval None
00152  ************************************************************************************************************/
00153 void HT32F_DVB_LEDInit(LED_TypeDef HT_LEDn)
00154 {
00155   u32 bGpioId = LED_GPIO_ID[HT_LEDn];
00156   u32 uGPIOPin = LED_GPIO_PIN[HT_LEDn];
00157   AFIO_MODE_Enum uGPIOMode = LED_AFIO_MODE[HT_LEDn];
00158   HT_GPIO_TypeDef* GPIOx = GPIO_PORT[bGpioId];
00159 
00160   /* Enable the GPIO_LED Clock                                                                              */
00161   /* Enable the AFIO Clock                                                                                  */
00162   _HT32F_DVB_ClockConfig(bGpioId);
00163 
00164   /* Configure the AFIO mode                                                                                */
00165   HT32F_DVB_GPxConfig(bGpioId, uGPIOPin, uGPIOMode);
00166 
00167   /* LED is off by default                                                                                  */
00168   HT32F_DVB_LEDOff(HT_LEDn);
00169 
00170   /* Configure the GPIO pin                                                                                 */
00171   GPIO_PullResistorConfig(GPIOx, uGPIOPin, GPIO_PR_DISABLE);
00172   GPIO_DriveConfig(GPIOx, uGPIOPin, GPIO_DV_8MA);
00173   GPIO_DirectionConfig(GPIOx, uGPIOPin, GPIO_DIR_OUT);
00174 }
00175 
00176 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00177  * @brief Turns selected LED On.
00178  * @param HT_LEDn: Specifies the LED to be configured. This parameter can be one of the following values:
00179  *    @arg HT_LED1
00180  *    @arg HT_LED2
00181  *    @arg HT_LED3
00182  * @retval None
00183  ************************************************************************************************************/
00184 void HT32F_DVB_LEDOn(LED_TypeDef HT_LEDn)
00185 {
00186   GPIO_PORT[LED_GPIO_ID[HT_LEDn]]->RR = LED_GPIO_PIN[HT_LEDn];
00187 }
00188 
00189 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00190  * @brief Turns selected LED Off.
00191  * @param HT_LEDn: Specifies the LED to be configured. This parameter can be one of the following values:
00192  *    @arg HT_LED1
00193  *    @arg HT_LED2
00194  *    @arg HT_LED3
00195  * @retval None
00196  ************************************************************************************************************/
00197 void HT32F_DVB_LEDOff(LED_TypeDef HT_LEDn)
00198 {
00199   GPIO_PORT[LED_GPIO_ID[HT_LEDn]]->SRR = LED_GPIO_PIN[HT_LEDn];
00200 }
00201 
00202 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00203  * @brief Toggles the selected LED.
00204  * @param HT_LEDn: Specifies the LED to be configured. This parameter can be one of the following values:
00205  *    @arg HT_LED1
00206  *    @arg HT_LED2
00207  *    @arg HT_LED3
00208  * @retval None
00209  ************************************************************************************************************/
00210 void HT32F_DVB_LEDToggle(LED_TypeDef HT_LEDn)
00211 {
00212   GPIO_PORT[LED_GPIO_ID[HT_LEDn]]->DOUTR ^= LED_GPIO_PIN[HT_LEDn];
00213 }
00214 
00215 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00216  * @brief Configures Button GPIO and EXTI.
00217  * @param  BUTTON_x: Specifies the Button to be configured.
00218  *   This parameter can be one of following parameters:
00219  *     @arg BUTTON_WAKEUP: Wakeup Push Button
00220  *     @arg BUTTON_KEY1: Key1 Push Button
00221  *     @arg BUTTON_KEY2: Key2 Push Button
00222  * @param  BUTTON_MODE_x: Specifies Button mode.
00223  *   This parameter can be one of following parameters:
00224  *     @arg BUTTON_MODE_GPIO: Button will be used as simple IO
00225  *     @arg BUTTON_MODE_EXTI: Button will be connected to EXTI channel with interrupt generation capability
00226  * @retval None
00227  ************************************************************************************************************/
00228 void HT32F_DVB_PBInit(BUTTON_TypeDef BUTTON_x, BUTTON_MODE_TypeDef BUTTON_MODE_x)
00229 {
00230   u32 bGpioId  = BUTTON_GPIO_ID[BUTTON_x];
00231   u32 uGpioPin = BUTTON_GPIO_PIN[BUTTON_x];
00232   u32 uGpioPinNum = BUTTON_GPIO_PINNum[BUTTON_x];
00233   HT_GPIO_TypeDef* GPIOx = GPIO_PORT[bGpioId];
00234 
00235   /* Enable the GPIO Clock                                                                                  */
00236   /* Enable the AFIO Clock                                                                                  */
00237   _HT32F_DVB_ClockConfig(bGpioId);
00238 
00239   /* Configure Button pin as input floating                                                                 */
00240   HT32F_DVB_GPxConfig(bGpioId, uGpioPin, BUTTON_AFIO_MODE[BUTTON_x]);
00241   GPIO_PullResistorConfig(GPIOx, uGpioPin, GPIO_PR_DISABLE);
00242   GPIO_DirectionConfig(GPIOx, uGpioPin, GPIO_DIR_IN);
00243   GPIO_InputConfig(GPIOx, uGpioPin, ENABLE);
00244 
00245   if (BUTTON_MODE_x == BUTTON_MODE_EXTI)
00246   {
00247     /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00248        Notice that the local variable (structure) did not have an initial value.
00249        Please confirm that there are no missing members in the parameter settings below in this function.
00250     */
00251     EXTI_InitTypeDef EXTI_InitStruct;
00252 
00253     CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{0}};
00254 
00255     /* Enable the EXTI Clock                                                                                */
00256     CKCUClock.Bit.EXTI       = 1;
00257     CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00258 
00259     /* Connect Button EXTI Channel to Button GPIO Pin                                                       */
00260     AFIO_EXTISourceConfig(uGpioPinNum, bGpioId);
00261 
00262     /* Configure button EXTI Line on falling edge                                                           */
00263     EXTI_InitStruct.EXTI_Channel = GPIO2EXTI(uGpioPinNum);
00264     EXTI_InitStruct.EXTI_Debounce = EXTI_DEBOUNCE_DISABLE;
00265     EXTI_InitStruct.EXTI_DebounceCnt = 0;
00266     EXTI_InitStruct.EXTI_IntType = (BUTTON_x == BUTTON_WAKEUP) ? EXTI_POSITIVE_EDGE : EXTI_NEGATIVE_EDGE;
00267     EXTI_Init(&EXTI_InitStruct);
00268 
00269     /* Enable Button EXTI Interrupt                                                                         */
00270     EXTI_IntConfig(GPIO2EXTI(uGpioPinNum), ENABLE);
00271     NVIC_EnableIRQ(EXTI_GetIRQn(uGpioPinNum));
00272   }
00273 }
00274 
00275 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00276  * @brief Returns the selected Button state.
00277  * @param  BUTTON_x: Specifies the Button to be configured.
00278  *   This parameter can be one of following parameters:
00279  *     @arg BUTTON_WAKEUP: Wakeup Push Button
00280  *     @arg BUTTON_KEY1: Key1 Push Button
00281  *     @arg BUTTON_KEY2: Key2 Push Button
00282  * @return The Button GPIO pin value.
00283  ************************************************************************************************************/
00284 u32 HT32F_DVB_PBGetState(BUTTON_TypeDef BUTTON_x)
00285 {
00286   return GPIO_ReadInBit(GPIO_PORT[BUTTON_GPIO_ID[BUTTON_x]], BUTTON_GPIO_PIN[BUTTON_x]);
00287 }
00288 
00289 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00290  * @brief Configures COM port.
00291  * @param  COMn: Specifies the COM port to be configured.
00292  *   This parameter can be one of following parameters:
00293  *     @arg COM1
00294  *     @arg COM2
00295  * @param USART_InitStructure: Pointer to a USART_InitTypeDef structure that contains the configuration
00296  *        information for the specified USART peripheral.
00297  * @return None
00298  ************************************************************************************************************/
00299 void HT32F_DVB_COMInit(COM_TypeDef COMn, USART_InitTypeDef* USART_InitStructure)
00300 {
00301   const HT32_Board_COM_TypeDef *COMInfo = &gCOMInfo[COMn];
00302   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{0}};
00303 
00304   /* Enable the AFIO Clock                                                                                  */
00305   /* Enable USART clock                                                                                     */
00306   COM1_CLK(CKCUClock) = 1;
00307   CKCUClock.Bit.AFIO       = 1;
00308   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00309 
00310   /* Configure USART Tx/Rx as alternate function                                                            */
00311   HT32F_DVB_GPxConfig(COMInfo->Tx_IO.ID, COMInfo->Tx_IO.Pin, COMInfo->Tx_IO.Mode);
00312   HT32F_DVB_GPxConfig(COMInfo->Rx_IO.ID, COMInfo->Rx_IO.Pin, COMInfo->Rx_IO.Mode);
00313 
00314   /* USART configuration                                                                                    */
00315   USART_Init(COMInfo->USARTx, USART_InitStructure);
00316 
00317   /* USART Tx enable                                                                                        */
00318   USART_TxCmd(COMInfo->USARTx, ENABLE);
00319   /* USART Rx enable                                                                                        */
00320   USART_RxCmd(COMInfo->USARTx, ENABLE);
00321 
00322   #if (RETARGET_INT_MODE == 1)
00323   NVIC_EnableIRQ(COM1_IRQn);
00324   #endif
00325 }
00326 
00327 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00328  * @brief Init BUZZER.
00329  * @param  hFreq: the PWM frequency of buzzer to be configured.
00330  *   This parameter can be 1 ~ 6000 (Unit: Hz).
00331  * @param  bDuty: the PWM duty of buzzer to be configured.
00332  *   This parameter can be 0 ~ 100 (Unit: %).
00333  * @param  mode: 0 for init, 1 for config.
00334  * @return None
00335  ************************************************************************************************************/
00336 void HT32F_DVB_BuzzerFun(u16 hFreq, u8 bDuty, u32 mode)
00337 {
00338   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00339      Notice that the local variable (structure) did not have an initial value.
00340      Please confirm that there are no missing members in the parameter settings below in this function.
00341   */  
00342   CKCU_ClocksTypeDef Clocks;
00343   TM_TimeBaseInitTypeDef TimeBaseInit = {0};
00344   TM_OutputInitTypeDef OutInit;
00345   u32 wCRR = 0, wPSCR = 0, wCHCCR = 0;
00346   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{0}};
00347 
00348   CKCU_GetClocksFrequency(&Clocks);
00349   /* Compute CRR and PSCR value                                                                             */
00350   wCRR = (Clocks.HCLK_Freq / hFreq) - 1;
00351   while ((wCRR / (wPSCR + 1)) > 0xFFFF)
00352   {
00353     wPSCR++;
00354   }
00355   wCRR = wCRR / (wPSCR + 1);
00356   wCHCCR = ((wCRR + 1) * (100 - bDuty)) / 100;
00357 
00358   if (mode == 0)
00359   {
00360 
00361     /* Reset buzzer Timer                                                                                   */
00362     TM_DeInit(BUZZER_TM);
00363 
00364     /* Enable Timer Clock of BUZZER                                                                         */
00365     BUZZER_TM_CLK(CKCUClock)    = 1;
00366     BUZZER_GPIO_CLK(CKCUClock)  = 1;
00367     CKCUClock.Bit.AFIO          = 1;
00368     CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00369 
00370     /* Configure the BUZZER_GPIO_PIN as Timer channel output AFIO function                                  */
00371     HT32F_DVB_GPxConfig(BUZZER_GPIO_ID, BUZZER_AFIO_PIN, BUZZER_AFIO_MODE);
00372     GPIO_DriveConfig(GPIO_PORT[BUZZER_GPIO_ID], BUZZER_AFIO_PIN, GPIO_DV_8MA);
00373 
00374     /* Init BUZZER Timer time-base                                                                          */
00375     TM_TimeBaseStructInit(&TimeBaseInit);
00376     TimeBaseInit.CounterMode = TM_CNT_MODE_UP;
00377     TimeBaseInit.CounterReload = wCRR;
00378     TimeBaseInit.Prescaler = wPSCR;
00379     TimeBaseInit.PSCReloadTime = TM_PSC_RLD_IMMEDIATE;
00380     TM_TimeBaseInit(BUZZER_TM, &TimeBaseInit);
00381 
00382     /* Clear Update Event 1 Interrupt flag                                                                  */
00383     TM_ClearFlag(BUZZER_TM, TM_FLAG_UEV);
00384 
00385     /* Init BUZZER Timer Channel x to output PWM waveform with 33% duty                                     */
00386     TM_OutputStructInit(&OutInit);
00387     OutInit.Channel = BUZZER_TM_CHANNEL;
00388     OutInit.OutputMode = TM_OM_PWM2;
00389     OutInit.Control = TM_CHCTL_DISABLE;
00390     OutInit.Polarity = TM_CHP_NONINVERTED;
00391     OutInit.Compare = wCHCCR;
00392     TM_OutputInit(BUZZER_TM, &OutInit);
00393 
00394     /* Enable CHCCR and CRR preload function                                                                */
00395     TM_CHCCRPreloadConfig(BUZZER_TM, BUZZER_TM_CHANNEL, ENABLE);
00396     TM_CRRPreloadCmd(BUZZER_TM, ENABLE);
00397     #if (LIBCFG_MCTM0)
00398     if (BUZZER_TM == HT_MCTM0)
00399     {
00400       /* BUZZER Timer Channel Main Output enable                                                            */
00401       MCTM_CHMOECmd(BUZZER_TM, ENABLE);
00402     }
00403     #endif
00404 
00405     /* Enable BUZZER Timer                                                                                  */
00406     TM_Cmd(BUZZER_TM, ENABLE);
00407   }
00408   else
00409   {
00410     vu32 *pCHxCCR = ((vu32*)&BUZZER_TM->CH0CCR) + BUZZER_TM_CHANNEL;
00411     TM_UpdateCmd(BUZZER_TM, DISABLE);
00412     BUZZER_TM->CRR = wCRR;
00413     BUZZER_TM->PSCR = wPSCR;
00414     *pCHxCCR = wCHCCR;
00415     TM_UpdateCmd(BUZZER_TM, ENABLE);
00416   }
00417 }
00418 
00419 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00420  * @brief Configure BUZZER PWM Frequency and Duty.
00421  * @param Control: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00422  * @return None
00423  ************************************************************************************************************/
00424 void HT32F_DVB_BuzzerOutputCmd(ControlStatus Control)
00425 {
00426   TM_ChannelConfig(BUZZER_TM, BUZZER_TM_CHANNEL, (TM_CHCTL_Enum) Control);
00427 }
00428 /**
00429   * @}
00430   */
00431 
00432 /* Private functions ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00433 /** @defgroup HT32F5xxxx_BOARD_Private_Functions HT32F5xxxx Board private functions
00434   * @{
00435   */
00436 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00437  * @brief Enable GPIO and AFIO Clock.
00438  * @param  GpioId: Specifies the GPIO ID.
00439  * @retval None
00440  ************************************************************************************************************/
00441 static void _HT32F_DVB_ClockConfig(u32 GpioId)
00442 {
00443   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{0}};
00444   u8 RegCK[GPIO_PORT_NUM] = {0};
00445   RegCK[GpioId] = 1;
00446 
00447   CKCUClock.Bit.PA         = RegCK[0];
00448   CKCUClock.Bit.PB         = RegCK[1];
00449   #if (LIBCFG_GPIOC)
00450   CKCUClock.Bit.PC         = RegCK[2];
00451   #endif
00452   #if (LIBCFG_GPIOD)
00453   CKCUClock.Bit.PD         = RegCK[3];
00454   #endif
00455   #if (LIBCFG_GPIOE)
00456   CKCUClock.Bit.PE         = RegCK[4];
00457   #endif
00458   #if (LIBCFG_GPIOF)
00459   CKCUClock.Bit.PF         = RegCK[5];
00460   #endif
00461   CKCUClock.Bit.AFIO       = 1;
00462   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00463 }
